title: Last major drop of Epstein files angers victim-survivors | ABC NEWS
description: 20 victim-survivors of abuse from Jeffrey Epstein have hit out at the US Department of Justice's latest drop of documents from the investigation into the late convicted sex trafficker.  The survivors allege the new release fails to protect the identities of victims and reveal Epstein’s co-conspirators, calling for more redactions to be removed. The newly released three million pages of documents include photos of Prince Andrew, emails from Elon Musk, notes about Bill Gates, and mentions of former Australian prime minister Kevin Rudd, former US president Bill Gates and the incumbent US president Donald Trump. title: Australia’s southeast gets reprieve after record-breaking heatwave | ABC NEWS
description: A cold front and a cool change are bringing much-needed relief to south-eastern Australia after a record-breaking heatwave.  Adelaide and Canberra will see their coolest day in a week, while snow above 900 metres is forecast for Tasmania.  The Bureau of Meteorology’s Jonathan How says more comfortable nights ahead are expected with temperatures dropping by 10 to 15 degrees. title: Delcy Rodriguez seeks to release hundreds of Venezuelan political prisoners | ABC NEWS
description: Venezuela’s Acting President Delcy Rodriguez has introduced an amnesty bill which could lead to the release of hundreds of political prisoners, including opposition leaders, journalists and human rights activists detained since Hugo Chavez’s presidency.  The move, in conjunction with reforms to the country’s oil industry, appears to be part of an arrangement with the United States for the lifting of economic sanctions after Washington captured the ousted Venezuelan leader, Nicolas Maduro.  La Trobe University’s Professor Raul Sanchez Urribarri says the interim leader is facing doubts among both Chavez supporters and pro-democracy activists, while the Venezuelan government remains an authoritarian regime. title: What do newly released Esptein files reveal and censor? | ABC NEWS
description: The US Department of Justice has released three million pages of files from an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, shedding further light on the late convicted sex trafficker’s relationship with Trump adviser Steve Bannon, Elon Musk and his network among Europe’s elite. US political expert Cory Alpert says, while the Trump administration’s reluctance to remove more redactions and release more material is ‘frustrating’ for many of the MAGA movement, it is unlikely to impact the mid-term elections in 2026 seriously. title: Iran blames gas leaks for deadly blasts amid US threat | ABC NEWS
description: Iranian authorities have blamed gas leaks for two separate deadly explosions in the country, as the threat of a US attack against the Islamic regime looms.  At least one was killed in a blast in the southern port city of Bandar Abbas, while at least four are dead after a gas explosion near the Iraq border.  The Iranian military is on high alert, with the country’s army chief, Amir Hatami, warning his forces to be prepared for any foreign attacks. title: Algal bloom causing ‘heartache’ on parts of Yorke Peninsula | ABC NEWS
description: The algal bloom has mostly subsided from South Australia's metropolitan beaches, but activity remains concentrated at the south-western tip of the Yorke Peninsula. Locals there say the algal bloom is causing a "sense of grief and a sense of frustration". Experts say the most recent testing has shown encouraging signs, with a drop in Karenia levels at some sites. title: Concerns around new high-rise civic centre rebuffed by Darwin mayor | ABC NEWS
description: As a 21-storey building takes shape in Darwin's city centre, set to become the new council chambers, there's concern it's coming at the expense of other much-needed community projects.  The Lord Mayor has offered reassurances, while the developer has suggested it will be a landmark at the "Paris End" of the CBD. Oliver Chaseling has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: 12yo shark attack victim honoured with paddle-out at Bondi | ABC NEWS
description: Hundreds of paddleboarders, friends, and family gathered at North Bondi to honour 12-year-old shark attack victim Nico Antic.  Organised by Rose Bay Secondary College, the paddle-out commemorated Nico as a "happy, vibrant, and social young person." A shark attacked Nico after he jumped off rocks west of Shark Beach at Nielsen Park in Vaucluse on Sunday, January 18. title: Australians to experience more 50C days as heatwaves intensify, experts say | ABC NEWS
description: Australians should brace for longer and more frequent heatwaves, with climate scientists warning that 50-degree days are now a permanent reality. This year's extreme temperatures have broken records in three states, signalling a shift towards what was once a rare event.  ABC meteorologist Dr Adam Morgan explores the implications of these 50-degree summers for Australia. title: Nationals leader David Littleproud to face leadership spill | ABC NEWS
description: Nationals leader David Littleproud will face his first leadership challenge tomorrow in Canberra. Queensland MP Colin Boyce is attempting to unseat him, though his success is unlikely.
